UI

Class ImageBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • UI.ImageBuilder

  • public class ImageBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Functionality for GUI to present and save images generated from .map and routing data.

      • buildImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage buildImage(char[][] map,
                                      int bfwidth,
                                      int bfheight,
                                      int[] start,
                                      int[] goal)
        Builds a BufferedImage from the charMatrix of the desired width and height (resizing used) with the specified start and goal locations.
        Parameters:
        map - charMatrix of the map.
        bfwidth - desired width of the BufferedImage.
        bfheight - desired height of the BufferedImage.
        start - the starting point of the path.
        goal - the end point of the path.
        Returns:
        the built BufferedImage, ready for display.

      • updateImageWithPath

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage updateImageWithPath(Stack<Vertex> route,
                                               int bfwidth,
                                               int bfheight)
        Updates the last built BufferedImage with the provided route, returns an image of the desired size.
        Parameters:
        route - the best route in an ArrayList format, order does not matter.
        bfwidth - desired width of the BufferedImage.
        bfheight - desired height of the BufferedImage.
        Returns:
        the updated BufferedImage.

      • updateImageWithPathAndComparisons

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage updateImageWithPathAndComparisons(Vertex[][] vertexMatrix,
                                                             int bfwidth,
                                                             int bfheight)
        Updates the last built BufferedImage with the provided vertexMatrix, returns an image of the desired size.
        Parameters:
        route - the best route in an ArrayList format, order does not matter.
        bfwidth - desired width of the BufferedImage.
        bfheight - desired height of the BufferedImage.
        Returns:
        the updated BufferedImage.
